Dear Mrs. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member hit a youth while being assaulted by the youth in
self-defense.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Youth A reported he was hit by Staff 1. Youth A was
hitting Staff 1 and Staff 1 began hitting him back. Youth A did not
receive any injuries from Staff 1 hitting him. Youth A did not know
how many times he was hit by Staff 1. Youth A did not want to talk
about the incident and provided little detail. Youth A did not recall
what parts of his body were hit by Staff 1. Youth A did not recall if
Staff 1 hit him with a closed fist or an open hand.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Youth A woke up and was refusing to do the daily
routine. Youth A ate his breakfast and then got up and walked out
of the unit. Staff 1 and Staff 3 followed Youth A to “shadow” him
meaning walking behind to maintain line of sight. Youth A walked
around the facility grounds for ten minutes. Youth A went to a
facility vehicle that had a broken window that had been covered by
plastic. Youth A took the plastic off the window and got a toolbox
from the vehicle. Youth A was walking with the toolbox. Staff 1
continued to shadow Youth A while Staff 2 and Staff 3 were in the
parking lot near the dumpsters calling for assistance. Youth A
threw the toolbox on the ground and the toolbox opened. Staff 1
went to reach for the toolbox and Youth A grabbed the toolbox
and began walking away. Staff 1 continued to shadow Youth A.
Youth A turned around and dropped the toolbox and began
walking toward Staff 1. Youth A did not say anything nor did Staff
1. Youth A began hitting Staff 1 in the face, chest, and eye with
his fist. Staff 1 reported she could not see from Youth A hitting
her in the eye. Staff 1 reported she was scared, and she reacted
by moving her right arm toward Youth A. Staff 1 did not know if
her right arm hit Youth A during this. Staff 1 reported she may
have hit Youth A however she was not intentionally trying to hit
Youth A, rather she was trying to get Youth A off her. Staff 1
reported it was a split-second decision that she regrets. Staff 1
2

reported she is trained to deflect punches when a youth is
assaultive by using an open hand and deflecting the punch. Staff
1 reported she did not do this. Staff 1 reported she was caught off
guard when Youth A began hitting her and she was scared. Staff 1
reported she has never seen Youth A assaultive as he was. Staff
1 reported she had worked with Youth A daily since he has been
at the facility. Staff 1 reported she made a big mistake and should
have been more aware and used her training in this situation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 2 reported she responded to assist with Youth
A. Youth A was behind the building and began pulling electrical
cords to the outside camera system. Staff 3 was able to get the
electrical cord from Youth A. Youth A began moving toward Staff
3 for taking the electrical cord and Staff 2 stepped in between.
Youth A pushed Staff 2 and walked around Staff 2 and proceeded
to go into the parking lot area to follow Staff 3 as she appeared to
be his target. Youth A approached a facility vehicle that had
plastic on the window as the window had been broken out. Youth
A got into the back of the facility vehicle window and obtained a
toolbox. Staff 2 reported she did not know what was in the toolbox
and wanted to get the toolbox away from Youth A. Staff 2 told
Staff 3 to call CRT and management on duty for direction on how
to proceed. At that time Staff 2 looked over and saw Youth A
hitting Staff 1. Staff 2 saw Staff 1 had her arms extended. Staff 2
denied seeing Staff 1 hit Youth A as Staff 2 reported she did not
see Staff 1’s hand make any physical contact with Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 3 reported Youth A was walking around outside
the facility and was not responsive to Staff 1 and Staff 3. Youth A
stated he was having chest pain. Youth A was offered medical
attention however denied being seen. Youth A continued walking
around the facility. Youth A walked to the back door of McDonald
cottage and Staff 3 attempted to talk to him. Youth A told Staff 3
he was going to get a key and began walking to the parking lot
area. Youth A began grabbing the electrical cord for the outside
cameras in the parking lot. Staff 3 reported Youth A began
targeting her. Staff 3 did not recall any specific ways Youth A was
targeting her. Staff 3 reported Youth A has a pattern of targeting a
staff when he is upset. Staff 3 backed away from Youth A. Youth
A went into the facility parking lot and approached a facility vehicle
that had plastic on the window. Youth A ripped the plastic off the
window and was able to get a toolbox/emergency kit from the
vehicle. Youth A began walking down near the garbage cans.
Youth A throw the toolbox on the ground. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were
3

still in the parking lot area talking and giving Youth A space. Staff
3 then saw Youth A by Staff 1 swinging and hitting Staff 1. Staff 1
had her head down. Staff 3 reported she did not see Staff 1 hit
Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Supervisor is a Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI)
trainer at the facility. TCI trains staff when a youth is
assaulting/hitting, the staff is to deflect the punches and step back
from the youth. Staff 1 did not deflect the punches from Youth A
and did not step back. Per the video, Staff 1 is viewed hitting
Youth A 4 times which is not trained per TCI. Staff 1 did not
deflect the punches from Youth A. Staff 1 did not step back from
Youth A as she was stepping in toward Youth A in the video.
Administrator/Complainant was interviewed face-to- face at
the facility on 12/11/2023. Administrator reviewed the video and
currently Staff 1 is placed on administrative leave pending the
special investigation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/4/2023 outside the facility was reviewed on
12/11/2023. Youth A walks into the back of the facility and is
carrying a toolbox looking item under his arm. Staff 1 is walking a
short distance behind Youth A. Youth A turns around and drops
the toolbox and walks up to Staff 1. Youth A pushes Staff 1. Staff
1’s arms can be seen going out in front of her. Youth A begins
punching Staff 1 in the head/face area. Youth A hits Staff 1 two
times. Staff 1 appears to get a hold of Youth A’s arm while Youth
A is hitting Staff 1. Staff 1 maintains close proximity to Youth A.
Youth A continues to throw punches and Staff 1’s arm goes
towards Youth A’s head area. Staff 1 hit Youth A four times. Staff
2 and Staff 3 come running from the parking lot.
Documents reviewed:
• Whaley Children’s Center Physical Intervention Policy:
Whaley Children’s Center utilizes Therapeutic Crisis
Intervention (TCI) model which includes personal restraint
strategies that are utilized when all other interventions in
the agency’s crisis prevention plan fail to protect youth and
others from unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior
that places youth or others at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs. The following are
prohibited: Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
4

• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 1 does not include any narrative
regarding Staff 1 hitting Youth A while Youth A was
assaulting Staff 1.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 2: Staff 2 does not include any narrative
regarding Staff 1 hitting Youth A while Youth A was
assaulting Staff 1.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 3: Staff 3 does not include any narrative
regarding Staff 1 hitting Youth A while Youth A was
assaulting Staff 1.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 1 received
TCI training on 9/20/2023, Staff 2 on 9/13/2023, and Staff 3
on 12/7/2023. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 had no
disciplinary record related to hitting a youth.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as video shows Staff 1
hitting Youth A while Youth A was assaulting her.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2022C0103024 dated 8/23/2022, CAP Approved 9/20/2022
SIR2022C0325036 dated 11/4/2022, CAP Approved 12/2/2022
SIR2023C0000058 dated 1/4/2023, CAP Approved 1/26/2023
SIR2023C0000401 dated 8/22/2023, CAP Approved 9/29/2023
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth was placed in a restraint not per the facilities trained
techniques.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Youth A did not want to talk about the restraint and
provided limited information. Youth A reported Staff 1, Staff 2,
and another staff restrained him however he did not recall who the
third staff was. Youth A reported the restraint was like other
restraints he has been put in at the facility. Youth A did not
remember how he was restrained. Youth A reported staff were
unable to hold him on the ground and released him. Youth A did
5

not recall how staff were holding him in the restraint. Youth A did
not recall how staff transitioned the restraint to the ground.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 1 heard Staff 2 and Staff 3 running toward her
and Youth A. Staff 2 and Staff 3 hooked Youth A’s arms and
transitioned Youth A to a supine restraint. Staff 1 reported she
attempted to help Staff 2 and Staff 3 get Youth A to the ground by
placing her foot behind Youth A’s foot. Youth A was kicking and
spitting once on the ground. Staff 1 told Staff 2 and Staff 3 to stop
the restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth A was taken to the supine
position by Staff 2 and Staff 3 dropping to their knees. Staff 1 did
not recall any staff using their feet to sweep Youth A’s feet
causing Youth A to fall to the ground. Staff 1 reported she tried to
grab Youth A’s legs from the front to get him into the supine
position which Staff 1 reported is not a trained TCI technique.
Staff 1 reported she knew what she was doing was not a trained
technique, so she stepped back and stopped. Staff 1 reported
she did not push Youth A to the ground.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 3 ran toward Staff 1
and Youth A and attempted to restrain Youth A. Staff 2 reported
the restraint was unsuccessful and Youth A was released
immediately. Staff 2 reported she secured Youth A’s arm in the
hook position and was holding his wrist per the TCI trained
technique. Staff 2 was on Youth A’s right side and Staff 3 was on
Youth A’s left side. Staff 3 had Youth A’s arm secured the same
as Staff 2. Staff 1 was right there to restrain Youth A’s legs. Staff 2
reported she and Staff 3 attempted to transition Youth A to the
ground and lunged to get Youth A in the supine position. Staff 2
reported she did not recall her or any staff sweeping Youth A’s
legs with their own legs to get him to fall to the ground as that is
not a trained TCI technique. Staff 2 reported no staff pushed
Youth A to the ground. Youth A started kicking Staff 1 in the chest
repeatedly. Staff 1 was unable to secure Youth A’s legs, so the
restraint was released.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 3 reported she wanted to get in the middle of
Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 3 recalled someone saying to restrain
Youth A. Staff 3 reported a supine restraint was attempted
however it was unsuccessful. Staff 3 did not recall how she
secured Youth A’s arms. Staff 3 reported she squeezed her hip in
to get Youth A and then stepped into a lunge to go to the ground.
Staff 3 reported this is how she was trained per TCI to get Youth
6

into the supine position on the ground. Once on the ground Staff
3 got into position. Staff 3 reported the restraint was unsuccessful
as one of the staff, unsure who, said let go. Staff 3 reported Youth
A was released, and Youth A and staff got up. Staff 3 reported she
nor Staff 1 or Staff 2 used their legs to sweep Youth A’s feet to get
Youth A to fall to the ground. Staff 3 denied any staff pushing
Youth A to the ground.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Supervisor reported she is also a trainer of TCI.
Supervisor reviewed the video footage with consultant.
Supervisor reported the restraint was not completed per TCI
technique. Staff 2 and Staff 3 engaged Youth A in the restraint
however TCI trains to restrain youth in the supine position by staff
lunging with their legs. Staff 2 and Staff 3 did not use the proper
lunge to place Youth A in the supine position as they used their
feet to sweep/hook Youth A’s feet causing him to fall to the
ground. Staff 3 placed Youth A in a side bear hug which is a
trained TCI technique that can be used for the staff to be able to
hook the youths’ arms.
Administrator/Complainant was interviewed face-to- face at
the facility on 12/11/2023. Administrator reviewed the video of
the incident and was concerned with how Youth A was taken into
the supine position.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/4/2023 outside the facility was reviewed on
12/11/2023. Staff 2 and Staff 3 run to Youth A from the parking lot.
Staff 2 is on Youth A’s right side, and it is unable to be seen per
the video how she is holding Youth A. Staff 3 runs toward Youth
A and places him in a side bear hug. Youth A is moving
backwards. Staff 2 is holding Youth A’s arm in the TCI hold. Staff
3 is still holding Youth A with her arms around his body as she is
standing at his side. Staff 1 is standing directly in front of Youth A.
It is unclear if Staff 1 pushes Youth A. It is unclear which specific
staff’s feet are viewed to be attempting to trip Youth A from
behind. Youth A moves backwards. Staff 2 and Staff 3 use their
feet to trip Youth A to cause him to fall to the ground on his back
in a supine position. Staff 3 maintains a hold of Youth A as he
falls to the ground and Staff 2 releases Youth A’s arm. Youth A is
laying on the ground and Staff 3 maintains hold him, and Staff 2
regains hold of Youth A’s arm. Staff 1 is kneeling next to Youth
A’s legs and is trying to secure Youth A’s legs. Youth A begins
bending his knees and Staff 1 continues to try to secure Youth A's
legs. Youth A kicks Staff 1 as she is trying to secure his legs and
7

Staff 1 attempts to continue to secure his legs and is kicked again.
Staff 1 then releases and stands up and moves back from Youth
A. Staff 2 and Staff 3 then release Youth A and get up from the
ground.
Documents Reviewed:
• Whaley Children’s Center Physical Intervention Policy: In
the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition,
medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and must be done
in a manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 1 documents an unsuccessful restraint
however does not provide any detail of the restraint and/or
technique used.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 2 documents a restraint was initiated
however unsuccessful due to Youth A repeatedly kicking
staff in the chest while attempting to restrain. There is no
documentation to provide any detail of the restraint and/or
technique used.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 3: Staff 3 saw Youth A assaulting Staff
1. Staff attempted to place Youth A in a supine restraint
however Youth A was kicking, biting, and spitting. The
restraint was canceled due to the positioning. Youth A was
released and stood up. There is no documentation to
provide any details of the restraint and/or technique used.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 1 received
training on the facilities Physical Intervention Policy on
8/30/2022, and Staff 2 on 10/31/2022, Staff 3 reviewed the
memo regarding Physical Intervention on 12/2/2022. Staff 1
and Staff 3 had no disciplinary record. Staff 2 had one
disciplinary record from 8/16/2022 regarding using
inappropriate physical behavior management. Staff 1
received TCI training on 9/20/2023, Staff 2 on 9/13/2023,
and Staff 3 on 12/7/2023.
• TCI Manual supine restraint: This restraint requires three
staff at all times. Obtain hold of the youth by grasping about
the youth’s wrist and go into the yoke position where staff
8

slide their inside arms under the youth’s armpit. To
transition to the supine position on the ground staff take
one step forward with their outside leg and kneels on the
floor on their inside knees. This will cause the youth to go
down backwards. The staff bring the youth the rest of the
way to the floor, taking their hand that was yoked under the
youth’s armpit and placing it on the should of the youth.
The third staff gets on the floor and wraps the youth’s legs
by extending their inside arm over the youth’s legs to
protect face and placing their outside arm under the youths
legs about the knees.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Youth A was placed in a
restraint and taken to a supine position in a technique that is not
an approved method of TCI.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not document a restraint on the MDHHS prescribed
form.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Youth A reported Staff 1, Staff 2, and another staff
restrained him however he did not recall who the third staff was.
Youth A reported he did not recall details of the restraint however
the staff were unable to hold him on the ground and released him.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 3 reported Youth A did not go willingly into the
supine restraint position.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/4/2023 outside the facility was reviewed on
12/11/2023. Youth A was placed in a restraint by Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 3 for approximately 45 seconds. Youth A’s arms were
secured, and Youth A was taken to the ground in a supine
position. Youth A did not have free movement of his body.
9

Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 169190214 dated 12/4/2023 at 9:40am coded as
Emergency Assistance with Law Enforcement contact
authored by Staff 5: The incident report does not include
any narrative about the restraint.
• Whaley Children’s Center Physical Intervention Policy:
“Emergency Personal Restraint” is the application of
physical force, without the use of a device, that restricts the
free movement of a youth’s body as an immediate
response to an emergency safety situation. Following a
restraint All incidents must be recorded on a restraint report
form by all staff members involved in the restraint to include
date, time and location of restraint, details of the incident,
the people involved (both staff and youth), the preventive
strategies that were employed, actual techniques used,
duration of the restraint and any injuries sustained by child
or staff, notifications made and if the child was required to
be put on suicide watch. These reports are required to be
placed in the Report Box located in each home and in the
Mott Children’s Residence by the end of the shift and are
collected daily by the Compliance Department.
● Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 1: Youth A was escalated from morning
routine and was not following directions. Youth A reported
he had been using a vape he found the day prior, and his
chest hurt. Youth A walked out of the cottage and Staff 1
shadowed Youth A around campus. Youth A began using
the vape while walking around campus. Youth A was
escalated while walking around campus and attempted to
pull cords for the outside camera system. Youth A went to
an agency vehicle and obtained a toolbox. Youth A broke
the lock on the toolbox and continued to walk around
campus. Staff 1 was shadowing Youth A around campus.
Youth A turned and walked toward Staff 1 and began
assaulting Staff 1. Two other staff came to assist and
attempted to place Youth A into a restraint however Youth
A was kicking and spitting. It was determined to release
Youth A from the unsuccessful restraint.
● Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 2: Staff 2 came to assist with Youth A
who was escalated and attempting to run off with an
electrical cord. Staff were able to retrieve the electrical
10

cord from Youth A. Youth A was threatening staff and
began walking toward a staff at which time another staff
stepped between. Youth A was in the parking lot and
began taking plastic off a facility car window and obtained a
toolbox. Staff 2 was talking with Staff 3 regarding
contacting management due to concerns of Youth A having
the toolbox at which time Youth A began attacking Staff 1.
A restraint was initiated however the restraint was
unsuccessful as Youth A was kicking Staff 1 in the chest.
Youth A was released.
● Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 3: Youth A walked off the living unit after
being prompted the school day was starting. Youth A
walked around the facility campus refusing to talk to staff.
Youth A obtained a vape from the ground outside the gate
of the facility and began smoking the vape. Youth A
walked around the facility grounds and unplugged
surveillance cameras in the parking lot. Youth A
approached one of the staff and another staff stepped in
between. Youth A went into the parking lot and got a
toolbox from a facility vehicle that had plastic on the
window. Youth A broke the toolbox open. Staff then saw
Youth A assaulting Staff 1. Staff attempted to place Youth
A in a supine restraint however Youth A was kicking, biting,
and spitting. The restraint was canceled due to the
positioning. Youth A was released and stood up.
● Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 1 received
training on the facilities Physical Intervention Policy on
8/30/2022 and Staff 2 on 10/31/2022, which addresses
incident reporting. Staff 3 reviewed the memo regarding
Physical Intervention on 12/2/2022 which did not address
incident reporting.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Youth A was placed in a
restraint as he did not have free movement of his body and the
facility did not complete the prescribed MDHHS form documenting
a restraint occurred.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
11

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facilities supervision of youth policy was not followed.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Youth A reported after he was released from the
restraint he got up and walked the opposite way from the staff.
Youth A reported staff followed him a few minutes later.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 1 reported she got up from the ground and
walked away as she felt she was the target for Youth A. Staff 1
reported she went into the cottage. Staff 1 reported she saw other
staff responding but was unable to provide names of the staff.
Staff 1 reported she did not know where Staff 2 and Staff 3 went
after Youth A was released from the restraint.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 2 reported once the restraint was released, she
gave Youth A distance. Youth A was walking around the back of
the building. Staff 2 reported she went through the building. Staff
2 was unsure where Staff 1 and Staff 3 were. Staff 2 reported she
went through the building to try to find additional assistance. Staff
2 reported there were not available staff to assist. Staff 2 reported
she went back outside, and Youth A was behind McDonald
cottage. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 was with Youth A. Staff 2
reported the supervision policy at the facility is to have youth in
line of sight during waking hours. Staff 2 reported she thought
Staff 1 and Staff 3 were outside with Youth A. Staff 2 did not
communicate to Staff 1 or Staff 3 that she was going through the
building. Staff 2 did not know if Staff 1 and Staff 3 followed Youth
A after he was released from the restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Youth A went back and picked up the toolbox. Staff 4
came to the area, and she thought Staff 4 was staying with Youth
A. Staff 3 reported she got up from the restraint and walked
through the building. Staff 3 met up with Staff 2 in the building.
Staff 3 did not know where Staff 1 was. Staff 3 reported she
needed to walk away from the situation for a minute. Staff 3 went
back to find Youth A outside McDonald cottage near the back
door. Staff 4 was inside McDonald cottage watching Youth A.
12

Staff 3 reported the facility policy on supervising youth is to always
have eyes on the youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Staff 4 reported she was in the upstairs of the
administration building and was contacted by CRT. Staff 4 was
able to see Youth A through the window and told CRT there was
no need for CRT to respond to the facility as she was already
there and would go assist. Staff 4 reported she was writing the
information in her supervisor log when she heard a “boom” and
looked out the window to see Youth A with the toolbox. Staff 4 left
the upstairs office to go down to assist. When Staff 4 was walking
on the side of the garage, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 walked up.
Staff 4 asked Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 where Youth A was.
Staff 4 was informed Youth A went around the back of the cottage.
Staff 4 did not know where Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were going.
Staff 4 went in McDonald cottage to go assist with Youth A. Staff 4
did not know where Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 went. Staff 4
obtained additional staff to assist her at McDonald cottage. Staff 4
did not know how long Youth A was out of staff line of sight.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to- face at the facility on
12/11/2023. Supervisor reported Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3
should have followed Youth A after he was released from the
restraint. Supervisor reported Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 did not
follow Youth A as they were seen on the video going the opposite
direction around the building.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/4/2023 outside the facility was reviewed on
12/11/2023. Youth A was released from the restraint. Youth A
gets up from the ground and walks to the toolbox he dropped on
the grounds and picks up the toolbox and walks as though he is
following Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 who walk toward the side
parking lot area and then turns and walks in the opposite direction.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 walk into the side parking lot area and
do not follow Youth A. Youth A walks to Vemco unit courtyard
alone. Staff 2 and Staff 3 are viewed walking around the back of
Vemco unit courtyard three minutes later and walk by Youth A and
continue walking around the building leaving line of sight. Inside
Vemco building video footage was reviewed and there were staff
inside Vemco building at the door watching Youth A who was

tools on the door.

• Whaley Children’s Center Child Supervision Policy: Direct
supervision constitutes children being within the line of
vision of staff and in close proximity, which means in the
same room or area. Supervision ensures the safety of all
children. Staff must never leave children unattended or
unsupervised.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 1: Staff 1 walked away from Youth A to
deescalate the youth from targeting Staff 1 again.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 2: Staff 2 does not include any narrative
of walking in opposite directions of Youth A after Youth A is
released from the restraint.
• Whaley Children’s Center Incident Report dated 12/4/2023
completed by Staff 3: Staff 3 does not include any narrative
of walking in opposite directions of Youth A after Youth A is
released from the restraint.
• Whaley Children’s Center Runaway/AWOL Policy: Youth
should be kept in line of sight; the youth is to be continually
shadowed while on grounds. Note: Observing the child
through the building or house window is not shadowing.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 1 received
training on the AWOL procedure on 12/1/2023, Staff 2 on
12/2/2023 and supervision training on 3/27/2023, and Staff
3 received residential policy and procedure training on

Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff
3 did not follow the facilities supervision policy of maintaining line
of sight during waking hours as Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 walked
in the opposite direction of Youth A after Youth A was released
from the restraint. There were no staff supervising Youth A at this
time.
Conclusion Violation Established
